alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk; Southern Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 11 at 5:15PM EST until January 13 at 3:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 3 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...1 1/2 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...In Connecticut, Southern Fairfield and Southern New Haven Counties. In New York, Southern Westchester, Bronx, Northwest Suffolk, Northern Queens and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 3 PM EST Saturday. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect 1 to locally 2 ft of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience minor flooding. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Potential for breaking waves of 2 to 4 ft during the Saturday morning high tide along coastal CT. This would result in beach erosion, as well as wave splashover onto shoreline roads and properties. * RIVERINE IMPACTS...Freshwater runoff coinciding with the Saturday morning high tide will exacerbate street and property flooding issues along tidal reaches of rivers in southwestern CT and coastal Westchester. Surge up the Hudson River with the Saturday morning high tide will likely cause minor flooding for low-lying river-front communities in Westchester, Rockland, Orange and Putnam counties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The timing of a wind shift from southeasterly to southwesterly gales in relation to the time of high tide Saturday morning will be key to the water level forecast. This will be refined over the next 24 to 36 hours. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. STAMFORD HARBOR AT STAMFORD CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.3 FT, MODERATE 10.9 FT, MAJOR 12.3 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 3.1 FT, MAJOR 4.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 11/11 PM 7.4/ 7.9 -0.5/ 0.0 -0.2/ 0.3 1 NONE 12/12 PM 8.9/ 9.4 1.1/ 1.6 0.5/ 1.0 0 NONE 13/12 AM 9.5/10.0 1.7/ 2.2 1.7/ 2.2 2-4 MINOR 13/12 PM 10.7/11.2 2.8/ 3.4 2.2/ 2.7 2-3 MODERATE 14/01 AM 7.2/ 7.7 -0.7/-0.2 -0.9/-0.4 4-5 NONE 14/01 PM 8.0/ 8.5 0.2/ 0.7 -0.2/ 0.2 3-4 NONE BRIDGEPORT HARBOR AT BRIDGEPORT CT MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
